isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: MERITOR WABCO WITH "D" VERSION ECU - REMOVE AND INSTALL - VALVES

step1.para: Turn ignition switch to the OFF position, apply parking brake.

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, put blocks under the rear tires to stop the vehicle from moving. Apply the parking brakes.

step1.para: Put blocks under the rear tires to stop the vehicle from moving.

warning.para: Do not work under a vehicle supported only by jacks. Jacks can slip or fall over and result in serious personal injury. Always use safety stands.

step1.para: If necessary, raise the vehicle off the ground and put safety stands under the axle.
Disconnect the wiring connector from the ABS valve.
Disconnect the air lines from Ports 1 (air supply) and 2 (air discharge) of the ABS valve ( Figure 24).
Remove the two mounting capscrews and nuts.
Remove the ABS valve.

caution.para: Moisture can affect the performance of all ABS/ATC systems, as well as the standard braking system. Moisture in air lines can cause air lines to freeze in cold weather.

step1.para: Install the ABS valve with two mounting capscrews and nuts.
Connect the line to the brake chambers to Port 2 of the ABS valve. Connect the air supply line to Port 1 of the ABS valve.
Connect the wiring connector to the ABS valve. Hand tighten only.
Remove the blocks and stands.
Test the installation (see below).

svcsubproc.title: Checking the ABS Modulator Valve Installation

step1.para: Apply the brakes. Listen for leaks at the modulator valve.
Turn the ignition on and listen to the modulator valve cycle. If the valve fails to cycle:

item.para: Use the Troubleshooting Guide to diagnose and repair the problem.

step1.para: Drive the vehicle. Verify that the ABS warning lamp operates properly.
Turn ignition switch to the OFF position. Apply parking brake.

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, put blocks under the rear tires to stop the vehicle from moving. Apply the parking brakes.

para.emph: Relieve line pressure by bleeding the air from the appropriate supply tank.

step1.para: Disconnect the wiring from the ATC valve.
Disconnect the air lines from Port 1 (air supply), Port 2 (air discharge), and Port 3 (treadle) of the ATC valve ( Figure 25).
Remove the two mounting capscrews and nuts. Remove the ATC valve.
Install the ATC valve with two mounting capscrews and nuts.
Connect the air supply, discharge, and treadle lines to Ports 1, 2, and 3 of the ATC valve.
Connect the harness connector to the ATC valve. Hand tighten only.
Remove blocks and stands.
Test the installation (see below).
Start vehicle.
Fully charge reservoirs with air. Shut off vehicle.
Apply brakes.
Listen for air leaks at ATC valve.
Release brakes.
Activate ATC valve.
Drive the vehicle. Verify that the ABS warning lamp operates properly.
